Interface LevelData.ShapeData

Enclosing interface:
LevelData
public static interface LevelData.ShapeData

A generic interface for a shape within an entity.

Author:
zdavis

Nested Class Summary
static class LevelData.ShapeData.Type
          An enumeration of the types of shapes that a LevelData.ShapeData can represent.

Method Detail

getType

LevelData.ShapeData.Type getType()
Returns:
the LevelData.ShapeData.Type of the shape (what kind of shape it is).

getCenter

Vec2f getCenter()
CIRCLE: the center of the circle POLY: the center of the AAB of the polygon BOX: the center of the box

Returns:
the point which is the center of the bounding AAB of the shape

getRadius

float getRadius()
CIRCLE: the radius of the circle

Returns:
the radius of the shape
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this shape is not a CIRCLE

getVerts

java.util.List<Vec2f> getVerts()
BOX: the vertices of the box in counter-clockwise order (clockwise if screen coordinates not math) POLY: the vertices of the polygon in counter-clockwise order (clockwise if screen coordinates not math)

Returns:
a list of the vertices of the shape in counter-clockwise order
Throws:
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if this shape is not a BOX or POLY

getMin

Vec2f getMin()
CIRCLE: the point (center.x - radius, center.y - radius) POLY: the "min" corner of the AAB of the polygon BOX: the "min" corner of the box

Returns:
the point on the bounding AAB of the shape with the least x and y coordinates (usually upper left)

getMax

Vec2f getMax()
CIRCLE: the point (center.x + radius, center.y + radius) POLY: the "max" corner of the AAB of the polygon BOX: the "max" corner of the box

Returns:
the point on the bounding AAB of the shape with the greatest x and y coordinates (usually lower right)

getWidth

float getWidth()
Returns:
the width of the bounding AAB of the shape

getHeight

float getHeight()
Returns:
the height of the bounding AAB of the shape

getProperties

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getProperties()
Returns:
a map of all the properties of the shape
